WspÃ³lna 1/3, [[Warsaw]] |employees = |budget = |chief1_name = [[Barbara Kudrycka]] |chief1_position = Minister of Science and Higher Education |chief2_name = |chief2_position = First Deputy Minister |parent_agency = [[Council of Ministers of the Republic of Poland|Council of Ministers]] |website = [http://www.mnisw.gov.pl/ www.mnisw.gov.pl] |footnotes = }} The '''Ministry of Science and Higher Education''' ''({{lang-pl|Ministerstwo Nauki i Szkolnictwa WyÅ¼szego}})'' in [[Poland]] was opened on 5 May 2006 by the Minister of Science and Higher Education, in replacement of several parts of the Ministry of Education and Science. The Minister of Science and Higher Education administers governmental activities in [[science]] and [[higher education]] and has a budget for scientific [[research]] provided by State funds. The [[Rada Nauki]] (Science Council) acts together with the Minister, in replacement of the [[Komitet BadaÅ Naukowych]] (Science Research Council) which was closed in [[2005]]. The headquarters of the ministry are located at ulica WspÃ³lna 1/3, [[Warsaw]]. == External links == * {{official|http://www.mnisw.gov.pl/}} {{Ministries of the Republic of Poland}} {{gov-stub|Poland (bordered)}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ministry Of Science And Higher Education Of The Republic Of Poland}} [[Category:Education ministries|Poland]] [[Category:Ministries of Poland|Education]] [[Category:Ministries established in 2006]] {{poland-stub}} [[pl:Ministerstwo Nauki i Szkolnictwa WyÅ¼szego]]
